item.title: India is enhancing its intellectual property infrastructure
item.description:
The Indian government has decided to continue its efforts to improve its intellectual property (IP) offices. This initiative, part of the 12th Plan (2012-2017), will cost Rs309.6 crore, with Rs258 crore allocated for the 12th Plan and Rs51.6 crore for the 13th Plan. This decision recognizes the increasing importance of IP in a globalized economy, India’s recent membership in the Madrid Protocol (April 2013), and the Controller General of Patents, Designs, and Trademarks (CGPDTM) office’s new role as an International Searching and Preliminary Examining Authority (ISA/IPEA) under the Patent Cooperation Treaty (starting October 2013)...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/india-is-enhancing-its-intellectual-property-infrastructure/

item.title: INTA: Companies that invest in trademarks make a significant contribution to the economies of ASEAN countries
item.description:
A new report from the International Trademark Association (INTA) reveals that industries heavily reliant on trademarks play a substantial role in the economies of five key ASEAN nations: Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, and Thailand. The report, titled The Economic Contribution of Trademark-Intensive Industries in Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, and Thailand, shows that these industries stimulate job growth across sectors and significantly contribute to international trade. Industries classified as “trademark-intensive” are those that file a higher number of trademarks compared to others, adjusted for the total employment within each industry...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/inta-companies-that-invest-in-trademarks-make-a-significant-contribution-to-the-economies-of-asean-countries/

item.title: Trademarks from Asia in a world that is interconnected
item.description:
Asian brands aiming to go global don’t have the luxury of slowly building a reputation over decades, according to experts who spoke at the 136th annual meeting of the International Trademark Association (INTA). This information was shared in a newsletter by IP Mirror, a company specializing in domain name registration, cloud hosting, and brand protection. Source: INTA website. The event, held in Hong Kong in early May, highlighted several strategies for Asian brands expanding globally, as reported by IP Mirror:..
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/trademarks-from-asia-in-a-world-that-is-interconnected/
